seo.title: Model Conferences Slovakia — Home
seo.description: MCS organizes model conferences for high school and university students.

hero.title: Model Conferences for Future Leaders and Diplomats of Slovakia
hero.desc: Experience diplomacy firsthand. At model conferences for high school and university students, you develop critical thinking, public speaking skills, and the ability to lead with respect.

about.title: What is MCS
about.desc: Model Conferences Slovakia (MCS) is a non-profit organization that shapes future leaders and diplomats. Through model conferences, we develop critical thinking, public speaking skills, and global awareness.

projects.title: Projects
projects.sampleDesc1: NATOBA is the first project of MCS: an international simulation of a NATO summit in Bratislava...
projects.sampleDesc2: MUN 2025 is a prestigious conference simulating the activities of the UN...
projects.sampleDesc3: MUN 2026 will continue the tradition of providing a platform for young leaders...

partnerCta.title: Support Young Leaders
partnerCta.desc: Do you believe in the education and potential of young people? Support MCS and become a part of projects that develop the leaders of tomorrow from all over Slovakia.

volunteerCta.title: Join Us
volunteerCta.desc: Want to experience conferences, gain experience, and be part of the team? Become a volunteer at MCS and help develop the future leaders of Slovakia.
volunteerCta.desc2: Become part of a community of young leaders, diplomats, and visionaries. Whether as a volunteer or an organizer, you will have a meaningful experience, new challenges, and room for growth. Join us and be a part of real change.

hero.title: Students Shaping the Future Through Dialogue
hero.desc: We are a community of young leaders, who, through simulations of international institutions, develop diplomacy, critical thinking, and the courage to lead, connecting students from across Slovakia to address global challenges today.

board.title: Directorate
board.desc: The Directorate is the highest body of MCS. It consists of three members including the chair. It handles legal matters, approves accounting, the annual report, statute changes, and oversees the organization’s development.

executiveBoard.title: Executive Board
executiveBoard.desc: The Executive Board has five members and oversees the Director, MCS strategy, and activity planning. It issues regulations and adjusts internal rules.

director.title: Director
director.desc: The Director manages MCS daily operations, coordinates projects, and represents the organization externally.

auditor.title: Auditor
auditor.desc: The Auditor supervises the financial and administrative correctness of MCS operations.

sectionLeaders.title: Section Leaders
sectionLeaders.desc: Six Section Leaders ensure running key areas of preparation and implementation of MCS projects.

volunteers.title: Volunteers
volunteers.desc: A team of 40 young enthusiasts organize events and spread awareness of diplomacy among youth at home and abroad.

criticalThinking.title: Critical Thinking and Argumentation
criticalThinking.desc: MCS supports the development of analytical and logical thinking as well as the ability to formulate and defend one’s views.

activeCitizenship.title: Active Citizenship and Engagement
activeCitizenship.desc: We prepare young people for active participation in society and motivate them to help solve societal and global issues.

dialogueUnderstanding.title: Dialogue and Understanding
dialogueUnderstanding.desc: We believe in the power of respectful, active dialogue as a tool for creating consensus among different views and interests.

personalGrowth.title: Personal Growth and Self‑Expression
personalGrowth.desc: We create a safe space to build confidence, express oneself, and present ideas without fear.

globalChallengesEducation.title: Education on Global Challenges
globalChallengesEducation.desc: An important value is raising awareness of international relations, diplomacy, and today’s global challenges.

creativitySolutions.title: Creativity and Problem‑Solving
creativitySolutions.desc: We encourage young people to be proactive and seek innovative, constructive solutions to the world’s problems.

adam.desc: Adam (16) studies at the bilingual Jura Hronca Grammar School. Growing up in Taiwan and Moldova shaped his interest in diplomacy. He actively participates in MUN, MEP, debates, and moot courts. By founding this initiative, he wants to help students develop critical thinking and interest in international affairs.

hana.desc: Hanka is a senior at ŠpMNDaG and will soon study international law in Amsterdam. She has attended dozens of model conferences, also helping organize them. She is in DofE and works with youth. At MCS she wants to make these experiences accessible to others and support education in diplomacy.

hero.title: Support the Education and Growth of Future Leaders
hero.desc: Help us develop critical thinking, public speaking, and civic engagement among students across Slovakia. Whether you’re an individual or a company, your support matters.

leaders.title: Educating Future Leaders
leaders.desc: Your support helps shape a generation of young people who want to responsibly influence the world around them.

impact.title: Real Social Impact
impact.desc: MCS conferences and programs build skills young people use in school, work, and public life.

criticalThinkingDialogue.title: Supporting Critical Thinking and Dialogue
criticalThinkingDialogue.desc: You invest in skills that build an open, tolerant, and informed society.

transparencyNonprofit.title: Transparent, Non‑Profit Organization
transparencyNonprofit.desc: Every euro goes directly to educational activities, not profit. We are open and accountable to donors and partners.

partnershipValue.title: Partnership with Long‑Term Value
partnershipValue.desc: We offer companies meaningful collaboration, visibility, and a chance to strengthen civil society.

communityChange.title: A Community Driven by Change
communityChange.desc: You join people who care about Slovakia’s future – educated, engaged, and ready to act.

taxDonate.title: Donate 2% of Your Taxes
taxDonate.desc: Decide where part of your taxes goes. Support the education and growth of young leaders.

points.2: Submit to the tax office or employer. Don’t miss the end-of-April deadline.

taxDonate.paragraph: Decide where part of your taxes goes. Support the education and growth of young leaders.

oneTimeDonation.title: One‑Time Donation
oneTimeDonation.desc: Even a one‑time contribution makes a difference. Support us via bank transfer or QR code.

points.1: Helps young people who want to grow

recurringSupport.desc: A small monthly contribution = a big difference.

transparency.title: We Act Transparently and Responsibly
transparency.desc: We believe trust is built through action. We publish all key documents, regularly evaluate our activities, and direct every euro where it has the greatest impact – into the education and development of young people.

cta.title: Become a Partner
cta.desc: Become a partner of Model Conferences Slovakia and help us develop critical thinking, dialogue, and civic engagement among youth. Your support is an investment in education, values, and the future of Slovakia. Together we can shape a generation that will change the world.
